name: Web Registries
description: Allow creation of custom registries, similar to customElementsRegistry, for many purposes.

name: Web Injectors
description: Dependency injection system for the web. Supports injector, provide/consume syntax.
details: The Web Injectors project aims to bring standard dependency injection to the web platform, solving the problem of loading dependencies without build tools or import maps limitations. It introduces injector, provide, and consume syntax to managing isolated contexts and explicit data flow.

name: Web Components
description: Enhanced implementation of Custom Elements supporting Scoped Registries and standard Dependency Injection.

name: Web Behaviors
description: Standard to allow custom attributes to add functionality to any HTML element.

name: Web Contexts
description: Protocol enabling hierarchical data flow and service provision across component trees, effectively solving prop-drilling natively.

name: Web States
description: Standard primitives for observability and state management (signals, stores, and schemas).

name: Web Tokens
description: Advanced parsing system for custom text nodes, attributes, and path expressions within the DOM.

name: Web Directives
description: Structural directives (loops, conditionals), comment markers, and template extensions for powerful DOM logic.
details: Extends HTML with structural controls like loops and conditionals. Includes 'Comment Directives' for attaching logic without wrapper elements (formerly Web Figments) and 'Template Directives' for advanced content projection.

name: Web Blocks
description: Standard protocols for interoperable modules (components, behaviors) ensuring consistent UX and accessibility across libraries.

name: Web Plugs
description: The missing browser standards (polyfilled). Runs 'plugged' (native patches) or 'unplugged' (safe libs) as the foundation for Web Blocks.

name: Web Intents
description: Declarative profiles for application-wide UX/UI behavior (e.g., density, motion, interaction models) that components automatically adhere to.

name: Web Traits
description: Standard for creating granular, auto-loadable features that bridge the gap between easy developer experience and optimal performance.

name: Web Adapters
description: Bridges and syntactic sugars connecting external libraries or languages to Web Everything protocols.

name: Web Docs
description: Standard defining documentation specs, static manifests, and usage examples for web projects.
